content: In online video conferencing applications, which parameter is the most important to ensure optimal Quality of Service (QoS)?
Which method is used to prevent unauthorized network intrusions and can filter out packets?

Suppose a packet is transmitted from host A to host B through a switch. The transmission rate from A to the switch is R1, and from the switch to B is R2. What is the total time to transfer the entire packet of length L from A to B? (Ignore all switch delays and signal propagation time)
What is the advantage of circuit-switched networks over packet-switched networks?
options: Ability to guarantee a certain amount of bandwidth for each connection
Can allow a larger number of users
answer: Ability to guarantee a certain amount of bandwidth for each connection

content: In a circuit-switched network, what is the advantage of TDM compared to FDM?
options: Does not require high hardware requirements compared to FDM
answer: Does not require high hardware requirements compared to FDM

content: Host A sends a 4,000,000-byte file to host B. The path consists of 3 links with transmission rates R1=500 kbps, R2=2 Mbps, and R3=1 Mbps. How long does it take in seconds for the file to reach B? (No other traffic, ignore queuing and propagation delays)
What is the correct top-down order of layers in the Internet model?
options: Application, Transport, Network, Data Link, Physical
answer: Application, Transport, Network, Data Link, Physical

content: Which statement is FALSE regarding Peer-to-Peer (P2P) file-sharing applications?
options: Hosts in a P2P network do not have clear server or client roles
Hosts have similar roles, but some must run permanently
Hosts in a P2P network have both server and client processes
All of the above are false
answer: Hosts have similar roles, but some must run permanently

content: TCP can combine with SSL to provide process-to-process security services. At which layer is SSL implemented?
An HTTP Client wants to download a webpage but the IP address corresponding to the URL is not yet determined. Which protocol is used at the Transport layer in this case to determine the IP address?
What is the fundamental difference between a router and a link-layer switch?
options: Routers forward packets based on IP addresses; switches forward based on MAC addresses
Router tables are set by admins; switch tables are set by manufacturers
Routers map output ports to IP; switches have no map for MAC to output ports
Router and link-layer switch are the same
answer: Routers forward packets based on IP addresses; switches forward based on MAC addresses

content: Host A connects to host B through 3 routers. How many network interfaces will an IP datagram pass through if fragmentation is ignored?
Which statement is FALSE about the IPv6 header?
options: The IPv6 header length varies depending on the packet size
The IPv6 header has fewer fields than the IPv4 header
The IPv6 header uses 128 bits for the source address
All of the above are true
answer: The IPv6 header length varies depending on the packet size

content: Which statement is TRUE regarding routers within the same Autonomous System (AS)?
options: Routers use the same internal routing protocol (intra-AS)
Routers use the same external routing protocol (extra-AS)
Routers have the same cost to go outside the AS
All of the above are false
answer: Routers use the same internal routing protocol (intra-AS)

content: Regarding the OSPF routing protocol, which statement is TRUE?
options: The router broadcasts routing information to all other routers within the same AS
The router only broadcasts routing information to its neighbors
The router broadcasts routing information to routers outside the AS
The router only sends information to routers newly joining the AS
answer: The router broadcasts routing information to all other routers within the same AS

content: How many fragments are created when sending a 2600-byte datagram into a link with an MTU of 600 bytes?
What is the size of the MAC address space?
What is the maximum number of VLANs that can be configured on a switch supporting the 802.1Q protocol?
Which command is used to configure RIP routing on a router?
Which protocol is used by Secure Socket Layer (SSL)?
In symmetric encryption, which of the following is true?
options: If key Ka is used for encryption, a different key Kb must be used for decryption
If key Kb is used for encryption, a different key Ka must be used for decryption
If key Ka is used for encryption, the same key Ka is used for decryption
Symmetric encryption does not use keys
answer: If key Ka is used for encryption, the same key Ka is used for decryption

content: In the DNS resource records, which type helps resolve a hostname to an IP address?

An student named An logs into the university email via a web browser to send a message to Binh. Binh usually reads mail on a phone application using the POP3 protocol to connect to the mail server. Which Transport layer protocol(s) are used in this situation?
How many sockets does a TCP server need to support N simultaneous connections from N different clients?

DNS service is used when you first access a website via a URL. Suppose n DNS servers are queried with query times RTT1, RTT2...RTTn, and RTT0 is the Round Trip Time between the browser and the web server. How long will it take to get the content if the page only contains a small text of 20 characters?
Choose the CORRECT statement:
options: When using a browser to access a page with text and 4 images, the browser sends only one request and receives 5 responses.
The body of an HTTP response from a server will always contain data.
Contents of two different objects on a webpage can be sent from the web server to the browser over the same TCP connection.
All of the above are false
answer: Contents of two different objects on a webpage can be sent from the web server to the browser over the same TCP connection.

content: Based on the provided diagram of Web Clients and Web Server B, what are the source/destination IP and port values for the packet returned from the server to Client A?
options: Source port: 80, Source IP: B; Destination port: 26145, Destination IP: A
Source port: 26145, Source IP: A; Destination port: 80, Destination IP: B
Source port: 80, Source IP: A; Destination port: 26145, Destination IP: B
Source port: 80, Source IP: C; Destination port: 7532, Destination IP: B
answer: Source port: 80, Source IP: B; Destination port: 26145, Destination IP: A

content: Suppose host A sends 2 consecutive TCP segments to host B. The first segment has SEQ = 120, and the second has SEQ = 140. How many bytes of data are in the first segment?

Suppose host A sends 2 consecutive segments to host B over TCP. The first has SEQ = 100, the second has SEQ = 110. The first packet is lost, but the second arrives at B. What ACK value will host B return to host A upon receiving the second packet?
Choose the CORRECT statement:
options: If host B has no data to send to host A, no packets will be sent from B to A in a TCP connection.
The size of a TCP segment never changes during the connection.
The size of a TCP segment must not be larger than host B's receive buffer.
If the SEQ of segment X is m, the SEQ of the next segment must be m + 1.
answer: The size of a TCP segment must not be larger than host B's receive buffer.

content: Host A and B exchange data via TCP. B has received all bytes from 0 to 126. A then sends 2 segments containing 80 bytes and 40 bytes respectively. The first segment has SEQ = 127, source port = 3033, and dest port = 80. What are the SEQ, source port, and dest port of the second segment sent from A to B?

Host A and B exchange data via TCP. B has received bytes 0 to 126. A sends 2 segments (80 bytes and 40 bytes). The first has SEQ = 127. If B receives the second segment before the first, what is the ACK value in the response to A?
Given SampleRTT values: 106 ms, 120 ms, 140 ms. What is the final EstimatedRTT if alpha = 0.125 and the initial EstimatedRTT was 100 ms?
Given SampleRTT values: 106 ms, 120 ms. What is the final DevRTT if alpha = 0.125, beta = 0.25, and initial EstimatedRTT = 100 ms, initial DevRTT = 5 ms?
Server A receives a request from client B via a UDP datagram and responds with a UDP datagram. If client B uses a spoofed IP 'Y' instead of its real IP 'X', where will the server send the response?
options: Server cannot send because it detects spoofing
Server does not respond to UDP

content: An IP datagram is sent from host A to host B through 3 intermediate routers. How many routing tables (forwarding tables) are used to transfer this packet?
A datagram network uses 8-bit addresses. The router uses 'longest prefix matching' with the following table. How many possible addresses will go through interface 2?
In a datagram network (Figure in Q32), set up the forwarding table for router A so that all packets from H1 to H3 go through interface 3, while packets from H2 to H3 go through interface 4.
options: Cannot be set up to satisfy the condition
answer: Cannot be set up to satisfy the condition

content: Assuming it is a virtual circuit (VC) network. Set up the forwarding table for router A so H1-H3 traffic uses interface 3 and H2-H3 traffic uses interface 4.
options: Table: [In Int: 1, In VC: 12, Out Int: 3, Out VC: 22], [In Int: 2, In VC: 23, Out Int: 4, Out VC: 18]
Table: [In Int: 3, In VC: 12, Out Int: 1, Out VC: 22], [In Int: 4, In VC: 23, Out Int: 2, Out VC: 18]
Table: [In Int: 3, In VC: 12, Out Int: 3, Out VC: 22], [In Int: 3, In VC: 23, Out Int: 4, Out VC: 18]
answer: Table: [In Int: 1, In VC: 12, Out Int: 3, Out VC: 22], [In Int: 2, In VC: 23, Out Int: 4, Out VC: 18]

content: A datagram network uses 32 bits for addressing. Assuming that the router has 4 interfaces (4 links) numbered from 0 to 3, packets are forwarded to the interfaces according to the following routing table. Where is the packet with address 11100001 01000000 11000011 00111100 forwarded?
Which subnet address matches the prefix 223.1.17/24 and can support 90 interfaces?
For a 32-bit address network, which a.b.c.d/x format correctly describes the address range for interface 0?
Given subnet prefix 128.119.40.128/26, which IP address belongs to this subnet?
What is the size of the LAST fragment (including header) created when sending a 2400-byte datagram over a link with MTU 700 bytes?
What is the offset of the LAST fragment created when sending a 2400-byte datagram over a link with MTU 700 bytes?
An IP datagram (including 20-byte header) is 1500 bytes. How many datagrams are created to send a 5,000,000-byte file?
Using Dijkstra's algorithm for the provided network, what is the shortest path from z to u?
In the provided AS network diagram, how does router 3c learn the path to x?

Assume that AS3 and AS2 use OSPF for internal routing; AS1 and AS4 use RIP for internal routing; and eBGP and iBGP are used for routing between ASs. There is no direct physical connection between AS4 and AS2. Which routing algorithm did router 3a learn the path to x from?
In an Ethernet network using CSMA/CD, what is the probability that a node chooses factor K=4 after the 5th collision? Write answer informat a/b.
In an Ethernet network using CSMA/CD at 10 Mbps, if a node chooses K=4 after the 5th collision, what is the waiting time in microsecond?
Which command is used to configure OSPF routing on a router?
Which command is used in DHCP configuration on a router?
Based on the provided network diagram, how many subnets are in this network?
After executing 'sh ip route', which line indicates the router has OSPF configured?
Which command is used to set the hostname for a Router in Packet Tracer?
Host 1 is trying to connect to Host 2. However, the interface of Router C is down. Select the correct statement:
options: Router C sends an ICMP message to Host 1 stating Host 2 is not responding
Router C sends an ICMP message to Router B stating Host 2 is not responding
Router C sends an ICMP message to both Router A and B
All of the above are false
answer: Router C sends an ICMP message to Host 1 stating Host 2 is not responding

content: Pinging google.com results in 'Request timed out' for all 4 packets (100% loss). What can be concluded?
options: The domain google.com does not exist
No response from the server at google.com
No response from the server hosting the domain
answer: No response from the server at google.com

content: What is the function of the Default Gateway in a Routing Table?
options: Specifies the next hop IP if the router/host doesn't know the path to the destination
Assigns a default subnet for the LAN
Determines the source address for all outgoing packets
It is the NAT address of the firewall
answer: Specifies the next hop IP if the router/host doesn't know the path to the destination
